data.title: 'Multidimensional poverty' a worry despite progress
data.description: While Thailand has managed to cut the number of people living in poverty by half in just seven years, many Thais still live with substandard living conditions-- lacking access to adequate healthcare, education, and sanitation -- especially those living in rural areas, according to the 2024 Global Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI).

data.title: Songkhla 'terrorist' gets jail time
data.description: Azman Porloh, a 29-year-old suspect in several terrorist attacks in Songkhla province, is facing more than five years

data.title: UN launches chemical sex health toolkit
data.description: Two United Nations (UN) agencies launched a chemical sex health toolkit yesterday during a two-day symposium held in Bangkok.

data.title: Migrants risk losing right to work, stay
data.description: Many employers and migrant workers have complained about problems tied to the new registration and work permit renewal requirements, which have reportedly led to large numbers of migrant workers missing the deadline and losing their legal status.

data.title: Trafficked antiques to be brought home
data.description: Antiques from the 3,000-year-old Ban Chiang World Heritage Site are scheduled to be returned to Thailand next week to mark the International Day against Illicit Trafficking in Cultural Property.

data.title: Obec probes school food, donation accusations
data.description: The Office of the Basic Education Commission (Obec) has inspected two schools in Chachoengsao and Nakhon Ratchasima after allegations were made online that one of them served spoiled fruits in student meals while the other was over soliciting parents for donations for a school van.

data.title: Charges due for 1st batch of iCon suspects
data.description: The Department of Special Investigation (DSI) is expediting its investigation into the first group of suspects involved in The iCon Group pyramid scheme, with its acting chief saying yesterday the process could be wrapped up as soon as today.

data.title: Govt set to visit  Koh Kut
data.description: Defence Minister Phumtham Wechayachai will visit Koh Kut in Trat on Saturday to reassert Thailand

data.title: PM pitches ‘3Cs’ approach at Mekong summit
data.description: KUNMING, China - Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra on Thursday proposed a 3Cs — connectivity, competitiveness and community — approach to build a stronger and more prosperous Greater Mekong Subregion (GMS).

data.title: Minister kicks off Space Week 2024
data.description: The Thai government’s determination to spur investment in satellite development and space infrastructure was highlighted at the opening of  Thailand Space Week  2024 on Thursday.

data.title: Thaksin ‘yet to testify’ in hospital stay case
data.description: Ex-premier  Thaksin Shinawatra  has yet to testify in a case in which he and the ruling Pheu Thai Party are accused of attempting to undermine the constitutional monarchy, as the deadline for public prosecutors to submit a report on the case to the Constitutional Court approaches.

data.title: Agencies take aim at mule accounts
data.description: The Department of Business Development (DBD) at the Ministry of Commerce is teaming up with the police Central Investigation Bureau (CIB) to combat corporate  mule accounts  and  nominee  operations.

data.title: Thai PM meets Myanmar junta chief
data.description: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra met Myanmar’s junta chief on the sidelines of a regional summit in China on Thursday, in a rare overseas trip by a general grappling with a civil war at home.

data.title: House, Senate hope to meet halfway on referendum
data.description: A compromise could be on the horizon between the House of Representatives and the Senate on the criteria for a  referendum  on amending the  constitution .

data.title: Maid sentenced to 235 years for serial gold thefts
data.description: KHON KAEN - A maid has been sentenced to 235 years in jail for dozens of thefts of gold ornaments worth about 25 million baht from her employer’s shop.

data.title: Mayor shot dead in Narathiwat
data.description: The mayor of a tambon in Rueso district of  Narathiwat  was shot dead by a group of men armed with  war weapons  at his garment factory in the southern border province on Thursday.

data.title: Lawyer, wife arrested for alleged fraud, money-laundering
data.description: Police arrested high-profile lawyer Sittra Biabungkerd and his wife on a highway in Chachoengsao

data.title: Bodies of four Thai workers killed in Israel to arrive on Friday
data.description: The bodies of four Thai workers killed by rocket fire in northern Israel on Oct 31 will arrive at Suvarnabhumi airport in Samut Prakan province on Friday afternoon.

data.title: Transport minister plans road safety campaign for motorcyclists
data.description: Transport Minister Suriya Jungrungreangkit has announced a plan aimed at promoting road safety, particularly targeting motorcyclists and their passengers who fail to wear crash helmets.

data.title: Maris allays concerns on Overlapping Claims Area in Gulf
data.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa sought to allay concerns over upcoming talks with Cambodia regarding issues related to the Overlapping Claims Area (OCA) in the Gulf of Thailand, stressing that for the negotiations to be successful, they must be mutually accepted by both nations.

data.title: PM signs off on Isoc integrity project banning 'gifts'
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra has kicked off the "No Gift Policy" for the Internal Security Operations Command (Isoc), ensuring its officers do not receive gifts in return for their services.

data.title: New panel to reduce school dropout rates
data.description: The Ministry of Education will set up a committee to lead efforts to curb high school dropout rates.

data.title: Frozen assets delay The iCon Group dealers' travel refunds
data.description: The iCon Group, the direct sales company at the centre of an alleged public fraud scam, has refused to refund its dealers

data.title: Patong to rejig motorcycle taxi rules
data.description: Phuket: Local authorities in Patong municipality are working to overhaul the city
